content.title: Shilp Sampada Term Loan Scheme for Backward Classes
content.department: Haryana Backward Classes and Economically Weaker Sections Kalyan Nigam
content.beneficiary: Artisans and handicraft persons from backward classes
content.details: The scheme 'Shilp Sampada Term Loan Scheme for Backward Classes' is implemented by the Haryana Backward Classes and Economically Weaker Sections Kalyan Nigam, Government of Haryana. Under the scheme, loans of up to ₹10,00,000/- are provided to artisans and handicraft persons from backward classes to preserve traditional arts and crafts. The scheme also offers training to upgrade their existing skills with the latest technological inputs, such as the use of computers, CAD, etc. The applicants must be between 18 and 35 years old, permanent residents of Haryana, and belong to the backward class.
benefits: Loans of up to ₹10,00,000/- for artisans and handicraft persons from backward classes to preserve traditional arts and crafts.
Training to upgrade skills with the latest technological inputs, such as the use of computers, CAD, etc.
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Haryana.
The applicant should be between 18 and 35 years old.
The applicant should belong to the backward class category.
The applicant's annual family income should not exceed ₹3,00,000/- in rural and urban areas.
documents_required: Identity/Citizenship Proof (Any one of the following): Aadhaar Card
Age Proof (Any one of the following): Aadhaar Card
Resident Proof/Address Proof/Ownership Proof (Any one of the following): Ration Card, Haryana Domicile Certificate
Caste/Religion Proof (Any one of the following): Caste Certificate for reserved category

faqs.question: What are the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Loans up to ₹10,00,000/- for artisans and handicraft persons. Training to upgrade skills with latest technological inputs like computers and CAD.

faqs.question: Is there an age limit to apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicants must be between 18 and 35 years old.

faqs.question: Do I need to be a resident of Haryana to apply?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicants must be permanent residents of Haryana.

faqs.question: What type of training is provided under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Training to upgrade skills with the latest technological inputs, such as the use of computers and CAD.

faqs.question: Can I apply if my family's annual income is more than ₹3,00,000/-?
faqs.answer: No, the annual family income must not exceed ₹3,00,000/-.

faqs.question: Is the scheme available to artisans from urban areas?
faqs.answer: Yes, the scheme is available to artisans from both rural and urban areas, provided they meet the eligibility criteria.

faqs.question: How can I apply for Scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligible applicants can apply online through the Official Antyodaya-SARAL Portal at https://saralharyana.gov.in/

faqs.question: How can I track my application?
faqs.answer: Applicants can track their applications through the Official Antyodaya-SARAL Portal by entering the Department Name, Scheme Name, and Application Reference ID at https://status.saralharyana.nic.in/
